detaileddescription.para: You can access the following array as in PrimitivePolynomials[i][j] with i and j counting from 0 in C convention. PrimitivePolynomials[i][j] will get you the j-th (counting from zero) primitive polynomial of degree i+1. Each one-dimensional array of primitive polynomials of a given degree is terminated with an entry of -1. Accessing beyond this entry will result in a memory violation and must be avoided.
